Articles.Content: I install BDarmory lasted version but when i shot bullet show #pink , and when active FLIR Targeting Ball i can't see anything it just #pink all is pink . How i can fix it??

19 hours ago, KranSmith said:

I install BDarmory lasted version but when i shot bullet show #pink , and when active FLIR Targeting Ball i can't see anything it just #pink all is pink . How i can fix it??

Hi which version of BDA did you install and from where?,  which version of KSP are you running?.  The problem you have can be caused by , incorrect installation, installation of incorrect version , and possibly any start options you have specified in the game shortcut. These facts and more can be established if you supply further details and a zipped copy of your KSP .log

2 hours ago, SpannerMonkey(smce) said:

Hi which version of BDA did you install and from where?,  which version of KSP are you running?.  The problem you have can be caused by , incorrect installation, installation of incorrect version , and possibly any start options you have specified in the game shortcut. These facts and more can be established if you supply further details and a zipped copy of your KSP .log

I use version v0.3.0.0 - Naval Combat Update from here : https://github.com/PapaJoesSoup/BDArmory/releases and running version 1.3.0

7 hours ago, KranSmith said:

use version v0.3.0.0

These facts and more can be established if you supply further details and a zipped copy of your KSP .log

19 hours ago, SpannerMonkey(smce) said:

 

 

Here : https://secufiles.com/dqMN/KSP.log

9 minutes ago, KranSmith said:

Here : https://secufiles.com/dqMN/KSP.log

Hi your install is a mess, you have either installed  the wrong  version or not updated BDAc or have overwritten a previous install,  when  all new BDAc  feature releases require a clean install of BDA to avoid such problems as yours, difficult to tell exactly what you've done.   You have several incompatible plugins mainly because of the mess BDA is in , you are also running obsolete plugins  DDS loader is now part of stock.

Suggestions, delete everything from your GameData folder except Squad and Module manager .dll ( yes everything as non of it is pretty )  then reinstall each mod, checking that you follow makers installation instructions, and that you only install current and updated mods.  Then retest.

Cheers

21 hours ago, SpannerMonkey(smce) said:

Suggestions, delete everything from your GameData folder except Squad and Module manager .dll ( yes everything as non of it is pretty )  then reinstall each mod, checking that you follow makers installation instructions, and that you only install current and updated mods.  Then retest.

Cheers

Ok , now i know why , because i run game with -force-opengl by KSP.exe Shortcut that why , just run game with KSPx64.exe ... Thanks you!
